thread.title: Costa float priced at $2.25

author: Post to Linkedin
title: Costa float priced at $2.25
text:
Frank Costa's Costa Group was seeking to raise between $541 million and $637.4 million. Jason South by Sarah Thompson Anthony Macdonald Jake Mitchell Costa Group's initial public offering is expected to price at $2.25 a share, equating to a multiple of 15.1 times forecast fiscal 2016 earnings, as revealed by Street Talk Online.
The fruit and vegetable grower's institutional bookbuild opened at 10am on Tuesday, with advisers Goldman Sachs and UBS taking offers between $2.20 and $2.70 a share, or 14.8 to 17.6 times.
The final price will be announced to the market on Thursday and the company is due to commence trading on Friday.
Costa was seeking to raise between $541 million and $637.4 million, implying a market valuation of $703.9 million to $839.4 million.
Major shareholder Paine + Partners will retain a 12.4 per cent stake after the listing, while the Costa family will control 10.5 per cent.
The implied forecast dividend yield for fiscal year 2016 was 4.1 per cent to 3.4 per cent.
The deal came after Costa management made their final pitch to prospective investors at a presentation in Auckland, New Zealand, on Monday, as revealed by Street Talk .
